metadata.title: CVE-2024-49967 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:ext4: no need to continue when the number of entries is 1

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-49967` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.11.0-13-generic - 6.11.0-13.14
linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-13-generic - 6.11.0-13.14
linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-13-generic-64k - 6.11.0-13.14
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-1006-gcp - 6.11.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-1007-lowlatency - 6.11.0-1007.7
linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-1007-lowlatency-64k - 6.11.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-1009-oracle - 6.11.0-1009.9
linux-image-unsigned-6.11.0-1009-oracle-64k - 6.11.0-1009.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in oracular was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.11.0-13.14').
linux-aws package in oracular is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '6.11.0-1007.7').
linux-azure package in oracular is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '6.11.0-1007.7').
linux-gcp package in oracular was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.11.0-1006.6').
linux-lowlatency package in oracular was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.11.0-1007.7').
linux-oracle package in oracular was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.11.0-1009.9').
linux-raspi package in oracular is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '6.11.0-1006.6').
